data.title: Great food in a basement
data.text: Really enjoyed our meal at Whig. It is a bar with some tables and great food. Everything is ordered at the bar. Tables are first come first serve.

data.title: Great food and beer in a unique location
data.text: I always bring family here when they visit from out of town. Reasonably priced food and beer. Limited menu but delicious. Beer selection is great. Juke box has some good classic rock and country mixed with more current hits. LGBT friendly, dark and cozy for couples.

data.title: Great  burgers and fries
data.text: Wary going in  and seeing what was behind the  door...amazing  burgers and fries. Settibg is dark and gothic ...burgers and fries amazing.  Definitely  returning!

data.title: Sketchy Entrance....
data.text: Saw the sign but wasn't sure about the entrance. Walked down a set of sketchy stairs to an almost invisible door. Inside....wow, it is eclectic, cool, a little weird, but oh so cool. They have a lot of beer on tap and the lady behind the bar was more than willing to help with a selection. She provided advice on the ones she knew about and samples of the rest. Didn't try the food but would recommend for the selection of beer and the ambiance.

data.title: So confused
data.text:
Alright so I try to keep up with the Columbia restaurant scene but I never before had stopped  at the Whig until last night. I had heard great things about it and seen it walking past the State House a couple of times so finally decided to try it out with my girlfriend last night for dinner.
Luckily I read some information online about going down the stairs and opening the large metal door so we got in. First, let me say the one positive thing about my experience was the decor and style of the place, I thought it was really cool how the area at the bottom of the stairway was lit with red lights and the inside of the Whig was low lit and decked out in interesting pieces. Don't know of any other place like it, so that was really neat. However, once we stepped inside and looked around the neatness stopped. Nobody said anything and we didn't see anyone to talk to about a table or anything so we just sat down. Upon sitting down the only thing on the table was a beer menu so we made up our minds on our beers of choice and just sat and waited....still nothing. After about 5 minutes we were wondering if anybody was gonna grab our order or anything but then I noticed everyone going up to the bar to order so I decided to check that out. Turns out Tuesday nights only serve tacos as the sole menu item. After some strange looks from the people inside we decided to leave and go to another restaurant down the street.
 I admit I have limited dive bar experience but some signs on the door or upfront letting newcomers know about how the place is run would be nice. Feels like a place that definitely caters to its usual crowd that knows what is going on there. I guess my girlfriend and I just didn't fit into that crowd. Nice ambiance like I said but the service if you don't know what you are doing is nonexistent.

data.title: I really don't want to tell you how much I enjoy this place
data.text:
Down a set of dark stairs at the corner of Main and Gervais, you need to pull on a heavy metal door to enter the establishment. 
No windows inside; you may have to brush by a hipster or an oldster or both to get up to the bar to order. 
The reward is: a really well thought out draft selection with super reasonable prices and a killer bottle/can list with a local focus. 
The menu is short and sweet and priced really well. I had the BLT last time and it was so well made! The cheese fries (ordered on another night) would probably feed an army. Think HUGE portions of fresh food (nothing is over $10) and cheap good beer and a friendly environment. They call themselves North America's Greatest Dive bar and they are totally right. 

(Side note: they'll never admit to it but these guys are always and forever donating their time, money and resources throughout the community to a variety of causes. If that is something that is meaningful to you, visiting and supporting them is another way to say thank you)

data.title: Under 21 - Don't Bother
data.text: NOT a food review: My friends and I, students here at USC, are huge foodies and enjoy trying all the restaurants Columbia has to offer. After looking at reviews of The Whig, we were excited to try it because of the great food reviews and unique underground location. It took us a few minutes to actually find it, and once we got in we found a seat and looked through the menu, deciding on what we wanted. Upon going up to order our food, we were asked for our IDs. We told them we just wanted food, and the woman told us you need to be 21+ for food. We were very confused because we'd never been turned down food because of not being 21! We even suggested getting carry out because we really wanted to try their food, but that wasn't allowed either. Very frustrating, especially considering there was no sign designating The Whig as a 21 and up location.

data.title: few Dive bars exist like this anymore...
data.text:
Classic Dive bar, the true definition of "dive bar".
Great selection of beers, including a number of random international beers. A number of rotating beers of tap including a good number of local (SC and NC) beers. Great prices, even better during happy hour.

user_location.name: Washington, District of Columbia, United States

data.title: What a dive bar should be
data.text: I am an urban girl. But I am also a girly girl. I had read the reviews about this place and wanted to try it while I was there. Normally, I cannot stand dive bars. However, the food and service was outstanding. I'm not sure why it is, but, for some reason, people who own dive bars seem to feel it's OK to have surly bartenders and servers. This is so not the case here. The prices are dive like, but, the service is not.

data.title: Dreams...at a dive bar
data.text: All I have ever wanted In this life was to have a few beers in a mole hole...With a saber tooth skull. Accomplished. They have a good beer selection and great food.  This place is an underground gem. Loved it.

data.title: Greatest dive bar ever
data.text: The burgers are the best you find anywhere.  Great bar keep and low key vibe. The crowd ranges from youg to old and everyone seems to fit in.

data.title: Cool Dive Bar
data.text: If you are looking for good late night eats, this dive bar is a good spot to consider.  It's in a good location, the prices are reasonable, and the food was pretty good.  Definitely a good place to go to grab a beer and some late night munchables.

data.title: Great place to have beer!
data.text: I went to The Whig to have some drinks. It amazed me that there were a lot of beers to choose from. This is a great place to go with friends and play some music in the jukebox. I didn't eat so I can't say anything about the food. However, if you are looking for a bar to got out with friends, this is a great place.

data.title: Meh...
data.text:
I'm going to give The Whig another try, because apparently their kitchen staff has Tuesday off, which is when I stopped in.

The Whig was described to me as a gastropub/dive bar, and it had elements I liked... relaxed atmosphere, cool, sort of creepy decor, friendly bar staff. 

But on Tuesday, it is Taco Tuesday at The Whig, and these are bare bones, less than stellar tacos. I think they were 50 cents a piece, and yeah, that's a heck of a price, but I wasn't there for a value menu :). One couple came in and ordered like 10 each, which pretty much killed the ambiance. Please, please don't sit by me to eat those!

Bottom line, they did have a good beer list, so I'm going to revisit The Whig on another evening.

data.title: Alternative and awesome
data.text: This place is a hidden gem. Literally, because it's underground and you have to walk down a shady looking stairway to find the camouflaged entrance. Local draft specials, a well-bearded bartender, and weird displays of insects as art--this place is unique and cool. Just go here!

data.title: Strange Place, Wonderful Burger
data.text: The Whig offers great burgers (and other stuff too) in an underground setting where you might run into a saint or sinner at the same bar.   It is never dull and always fun.

data.title: Cool Bar
data.text:
My party came for drinks so I can't comment on the food. The place has all the makings of a first rate dive bar. 

Walking down the steps and seeing the bars on the windows, I commented to my friends that this is the type of place that vampires draw victims too, but in a good way. 

Great drink specials and a really cool style (see the large stuffed cat holding the stuffed rabbit in its mouth who in turn is wearing Mardi Gras beads). 

I would go back for cocktails for sure. As I said, no food was eaten by my group so I can't comment.

data.title: Hidden gem
data.text:
Heard about this place online and decided to go down the steps and check it out! This is my new favorite place in Columbia!

All you need to know is they have a jukebox, an Atari game that has PacMan and Galaga, and a good beer list that even includes draft cider.

For food we tried the fries with gravy and cheese for an appetizer. The portion was huge... more of an appetizer size for four people than two. I had the chicken sandwich which came with pimento cheese. SO GOOD.

data.title: One of my favorite bars in SC
data.text: The staff is always friendly and the atmosphere is relaxed.  The Whig has great food - my favorites are the pimento cheese dip and their pizza - as well as a fairly large beer selection.  Whenever I can, I try to make it to $1 slice night on Mondays and 50 cent taco night on Tuesdays! In all, it's the perfect place to meet friends after work for a drink or two!

data.title: a nice surprise
data.text: we stopped in here friday night for a quick cocktail and a bite to eat just before the jazz show at the capitol grounds. we were very happily  surprised  when we went down stairs to the  restuarant. a wonderful atmosphere and  courteous  bartenter greated us  and  a fine bite to eat was had!!  we  will cetainly return and explore  all the additional offerings on the menu  very soon!! this is a very nice place  to see and eat at!!
